Class VirtualServer

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.gc11.network.client.VirtualServer
public class VirtualServer extends Object
Handles the local client-side logic and acts as an intermediary between the UI layer (via PlayerContext) and the network communication layer (via Client).

VirtualServer is responsible for initializing the connection to the remote server using either RMI or sockets, sending actions to the server, and receiving and executing incoming actions asynchronously. It also manages session state and pinging the server to keep the session alive.

  • Constructor Details

    • VirtualServer

      public VirtualServer(PlayerContext playerContext, int pingInterval, boolean startPingExecutor)
      Constructs a new VirtualServer instance.
      Parameters:
      playerContext - the context associated with the client-side game logic and view updates
      pingInterval - the interval in milliseconds between ping messages
      startPingExecutor - whether to start the periodic ping thread upon session setup

  • Method Details

    • initializeConnection

      public void initializeConnection(Utils.ConnectionType type, String ip, int port) throws NetworkException
      Initializes the network connection to the server using the specified protocol.
      Parameters:
      type - the connection type (Utils.ConnectionType.RMI or Utils.ConnectionType.SOCKET)
      ip - the server's IP address
      port - the port to connect to
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if the connection fails

    • setSessionData

      public void setSessionData(String username, UUID token)
      Sets the client's session data and optionally starts the ping thread.
      Parameters:
      username - the player's username
      token - the unique session token assigned by the server

      public UUID getSessionToken()
      Returns the client's session token.
      Returns:
      the session token
